review_blob: On Tap @ Oak Cafe Bells Stout Fest Pored Black little to no head Roasty bourbon aroma some vanilla . Sticky mouth feel Nice choclate sweet bourbon flavor littl licorice twords finish.

22oz poured out a fizzy off white head a muddy ruby brown with some particulate. Aroma was Mildly citrus some malt backbone. Flavor was mild bitter some roast malt with a creamy finish. A possible session beer..

22oz bottle One of the best heads on an IPA I have seen. Well carbonated and beautiful lacing. Nice hoppy aroma piney, citrus and a faint smell of coffee in the aromas. Robust hop flavor ful of citrus nicely done. Not what I had expected
750 ml bottle . Pored a nice trasperent gold  nice fizzy head. Aroma was strong a ton of hop and pine. A wild array of flavor to much to describe. I would definitly drink one again
Dark copper appearance light minimal tan head nice spice and fruit aroma. Flavor was spicy fruity lightly malty nice mild flavor..

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob: 750 ml bottle poured with  a nice pillow fluffy white head slight hazed straw yellow color. Nice aromas of orange and flower almost perfume like. Flavor was mellow with a fizzy mouthfeel with mice yeasty notes and clover honey finish.

Poured a deep reddish brown. amazing carbonation very nice head Lots of raisins and leather in the nose some fruitiness and earthiness. Some alc at first but was not noticeable at the second whiff. Very rich mouthfeel like others have said "similar to the 12 but not as refiened ".

Pours deep black with a mild tan to brown head. There was a little confusion I had ordered a case of 06/07 but the neck rings were dated  04/05. When I had opened a bottle I hoped that it was 04/05 but it was not . The aroma was a little confusing with notes of chocolate and roasted malt almost like the porter but when I had tasted it I could easily tell that is was not the porter. Giving off a mild body of chocolate and malt with some notes of sweetness in the finish.

2004 bottle pours a murky brown with some yeast floaties. Dark tan head somkewhat foamy . Arome is quite mild with a few notrs of hop citrus and a leathery molasses and dark cherry. Flavor is quite rtich with coca, toffe molasses and a doughy finish .
beer_name: Hitachino Nest New Year Celebration Ale

review_blob: Thanks to Pailhead and the columbus crew! Dark brown to black nice brown head Amazing notes of oak, coffee, coffee and vanilla. Flavor was extremely well rounded Huge roast malt  with oak chocolate and vanilla .Not to overpowering bourbon flavor. I am very impressed ...

Thanks pailhead not sure on the vintage . Pours a ruby amber with little to no head what else do you expect from an aged barley wine. Huge alcohal flavor backed by a carmely malt flavor. Huge hop flavor with sone pine citrus and  a doughy malty finish ..

thanks to pailhead for sharing . Pours a pale copper very nice white foamy head. Aromas of spices yeast citrus followed by a nice whiff of hops. Mellow hop appeal Im not sure on the date of this one seemed to mellow vwry niclely some hints of spice with a mild hint of earthyness.

Thanks to pailhead for this one Pours black as it gets with a medium fluffy brown head that dissapeard quite quickly. Nice roasty and chocolate malt aromas. Flavors were coffeee light licorice roasted malt some carmel in there light hints of cherry very stick mouthfeel  though.
Deep mahogony with a bubily off white head. Light malt aroma not much there. Flavor was mild as well light malt fruitiness some coca.
Bottle # 9 Nice transperent copper color with a bubily white head  Aroma were earthy with hints of citrus and somewhat yeasty. A noticeable sweet honey flavor with a mild corriander finish

Poured a deep mohagony to black fluffy brown head. A sweet and grass like aroma was present with a touch of roast malt. Flavor was sweet with noticable notes of molases and honey backed up by dark fruit..

12 oz bottle Poured with a intense carbonation to a thick frothy off white head . Plenty of hop aroma for a regular IPA. Brilliant copper in color. Nice malty flavor for a IPA  Some carmel and a hint of roast in there . A lot more than I expected.
beer_name: Flying Fish HopFish India Pale Ale

review_blob: On Tap @ Oak Cafe Poured a pale copper with a slight off white head. Very light head retention aswell. Aroma was at first a huge whiff of bourbon the nmellowed and vanilla and hop aroma became present. The bourbon masked the citrus hop aromas they became noticeable after a sip. Medium bourbon flavor  Nice sweet flavor mild to rich hop flavor throughout. Medium to thin body sweet finish
beer_name: New Holland Oak Aged Hatter IPA

review_blob: On draft @ Oak Cafe Poured black with a huge tan brown two finger head .. Roasted carmel malt aroma with a a touch of smoke. Some dark fruit. Lots of roasted malt flavor and seems to me a smoked malt flavoer. some hints of toffee. Creamy finish with a great amount of lacing..

Poured a hazy straw yellow mice fluffy white head. Aromas were grapfruit hop and citrus. Flavor reflected the aroma with grapfruit and citrus with a piny like flavor as well as a earthy note. well balanced flavor quite simple and good

Bottle got this one from my broher in law when he came over from Ireland. Poured a nice amber with a off white to tan head very nice head. Decent lacing for this style of beer. What got me was the aroma it seemed like a old woll sweater I did not pick up much or the herbal notes that the others that I had shared with. Quite interesting herbal flavor some licorice somewhat like a ricola cough drop. decent malt flavor throughout...

11.2 oz bottle Poured a nice straw yellow with a fluffy white head . Nice sour aromas from a distance notes of oak as well The head dissappeared quickly Flavor was apple grape and notes of oak ... A little on the sweet side but not to overpowering...

beer_brewer_name: Leinenkugel Brewing Company (Tenth & Blake Beer Co.)
review_blob: Poured a hazy orange with a nice creamy white head Aromas of citrus and lemon right of the bat. Flavor was mild not as bad as some other macro wheats.. Lots of corriander not a bad beer but a little on the fake side..

On draft @ Oak Cafe. Poured a hazy orange with a light white head not much head or retention. A very noticable aroma of banana up front some hints of clove and malt .. Flavor is somewhat yeasty with a large amount of banana and bubble gum Nice mild oily mouthfeel. Little to no lacing not bad ...

On tap at the brew pub A deeep amber color little to no head aromas were dark fruit and and malt nothing that great out of this one ... I miss the old brewery  yuletide porter and frankenmuth dark those were the days what happened !!!!! A tourist trap...

On tap @ brewery of course. Poured a hazy straw yellow nice white head  aromas were mild some clove thats about it ... Flavor was a bit on the weak side I sat and watched the bartender convert bud light drinkers with this one while I finished this dissapointing beer

16.9 oz bottle Pours a brilliant gold color nice carbonation with a bubily white head. aromas were bubble gum yeasty and citrusy. flavor was a malty sweet with a citrus flavor not bad ... I actually like this one ???

12 oz bottle, poured a nice amber copper color brilliant fluffy white head nice lacing. Aroma was quite weak for a imperial ipa. body was also off a bit thin. Simple ipa aromas and flavors not much else...
beer_name: Nine G Infidel Imperial India Pale Ale

review_blob: Thanks Styles for picking me up some of this.... Pours black with a nice brown to tan head Aromas were earthy and bourbon with nice roast malt and dark fruit. Flavor was bourbon up front and then a nice array of roast and chocolate malt flavors also picked up some licorice and pepper at the finish. Amazing!
Amber color slight haze no head Nice aromas of fruit and dark fruit. Flavor is very sweet not much dark fruit flavor but some nice yeasty and spice flavor. lightly carbonated

12 oz bottle pretty fresh. Poures a dark orangish with a little haze no head whatsoever. Aroma were slightly wheaty with some yeasty spice. Flavors were mild with some clove and wheat light citrus as well Not a big beer but not bad

22 oz bottle 2004 edition thanks to Styles for sharing. Foured a hazed orangish brown light bubily white head that dissappeared quick. Aromas were extremely hoppy with grass earth and spice . Flavor had a sourness to it that masked the other flavors from really shining through... Would have to re rate soon...

Growler thanks Styles.. A tad bit of oxidation oh well.. A noticiable aroma of pine with an array of hop aromas citrus, grapefruit and some spice in there. Appearance was a brilliant golden head was minimal due to growlers age. Nice balance to its overall flavors. Not to citrusy malt balances it out very well

Served from a growler Thanks Styles.. Poured with a light white head slight loss of carbonation from a few day old growler to be expected though nice ruby brown appearance. Aromas were initially dark fruit and cherry then a nice whiff of alcohol . Flavor was big with cherry and fig a noticable presence of alcohol definitly. Some shocolate in the finish but not ot big .. I would like to try straight from the tap one day

Thanks for sharing pail head. First off this beer poured with the most fluffy head that I have ever seen nice cloudy gold appearance and the head is still there ... Nice belgian like yeast aroma backed up by the pleasent smell of hops. Mouthfeel was just a tad over light  flavor was like a blonde meets an IPA. Nice hop flavor with a belgian wit like taste..

Bottle, Might gold orange color with a foamy white head. Good Carbonation. Nice light flavor with a sweet raspberry flavor In my opinion a great chick beer the raspberries has to come from extract though

Thanks to pailhead Pours a dark deep brown to black with nice tan brown head that dissapeared quickly. Aroma was big with liqorice then the chocolate aromas had become present. Flavor was amazing and well balanced with vanilla chocolate. NIce toffe finish.. Nice brew indeed ..
beer_name: Tyranena BGW Whos Your Daddy? Bourbon Barrel-Aged Imperial Porter

review_blob: 1.5 liter bottle 2000 vintage... I waited foe the right time to crack this bottle and indeed it was. In great compant as well! Pours a ruby brown huge aroma right out of the bottle. nive off white head.. Nice dry flavor due to aging ... Aroma was fuity and yeasty.. flavor was a dry sour with nice fruitiness ....  I would write more but I am in a middle of the glass and damn I want to drink it..
thanks pailhead for sharing.. Beautiful dark amber with a tan head huge aroma of mals chocolate and hops.. Flavor was dark fruit hops, carmel malt with huge amounts ofit ...

Pours a clear golden copper with a fluffy white heat. Instant aroma of hops  citrus and grass, backed up by huge alcohol heat. Flavor is sweet sweet sweet with that alcohol burn at the end.. I had one a few years back and I am amazed that the consistency is right on...

Thanks Pailhead.. One of the best aromas I have ever smelled... Huge Mocha Coffee aroma with a solid backing of licorice vanilla and spices. Poured a midnight black with a foamy tan brown head .. Big Malty flavor with roast and carmel. Followed by a nice hit of toffee. Thick as a porter can get .. But we cant forget about the hops... very nice ..
beer_name: Three Floyds Alpha Klaus Christmas Porter

review_blob: On tap @ Oak Cafe Michigan Poured a deep mohagony with a tan fluffy head. Aroma was somewhat doughy with a background of cherries and fruit. Flavor was somewhat balanced with slight sourness not to overpowering..
Thanks to Pailhead for sharing.. pours a ruby red to brown with a off white quick head a ton of carmel and alcohol in the nose . Huge alcohol presence backed up by candi surgar. WOW
beer_name: Dogwood Mark and Teds Excellent Adventure

review_blob: Pours Black with a tan to brown foamy head Aromas are a mild  anilla and chocolate. Flavor is much bigger Coffee Roast malt Molasses and chocolate..
beer_name: Scotch Irish Tsarina Katarina Imperial Stout

review_blob: Vintage 2000 poured a slight mirky brown with a fluffy off white head. I noticed a ton of particulate. Aroma was raisin with dark fruit and some alcohol heat in there. Flavor was bursting with apple, plum and chocloate..
beer_name: Gouden Carolus Cuvee Van De Keizer Blauw/Blue

review_blob: 22 oz bottle just arrived today... Ill keep it simple here BOURBON! Maybe a little time will heal this one

On tap Poured a brilliant ruby amber. Nice big foamy frorthy off white head Great lacing as well. Floral hop aromas right off the bat. SXome fruit in there as well. Flavor boasted a huge hop flavor that balanced out the strong alcohol content.. Flavor is well backed with a carmel malt flavor. For 13 percent it is indeed dangerous.
On tap. Did not resemble a scotch ale to me more like a english strong ale it lacked  the chocolate and maltiness for me to agree with  the style. still drinkable
on tap to keep it on the short side a decent brown ale meets the right amount of bourbon  flavor not bad...
beer_name: Sports Brew Pub Bourbon Barrel Brown

review_blob: 2005 bottle thnks to pailhead Poured with a fluffy to foamy tan to off white head copper amber in color Aromas were grassy to earthy slight citrus flavor was mellow hoppy a bit of a change here compared to the rest of the big ipas
